title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Northern, Eastern, and Uva provinces and in the Hambantota, Polonnaruwa, Nuwara Eliya, and Matale districts.

title: Ex-President Ranil to make special statement on ‘Batalanda’ Commission report today
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe is set to deliver a special statement today (16) regarding the allegations mentioned in the ‘Batalanda’ Commission report.

title: Trump orders strikes on Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen and issues new warning
byline: President Donald Trump said he ordered a series of airstrikes on the Houthi-held areas in Yemen on Saturday, promising to use “overwhelming lethal force” until Iranian-backed Houthi rebels cease their attacks on shipping along a vital maritime corridor.

title: Postal workers to stage 48-hour token strike starting today?
byline: The Postal and Telecommunications Officers’ Union and the United Postal Trade Unions Front (UPTUF) have announced a 48-hour token strike starting from 4.00 p.m. today (16) until March 18.

title: Parliament to debate ‘Batalanda’ Commission report on April 10
byline: The Parliamentary Communications Department has announced that the parliamentary debate on the ‘Batalanda’ Commission report will commence on April 10.

title: Foreign Minister urges public to verify private employment agencies via hotline
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, has urged the public to contact the ‘1989’ hotline for reliable information about private employment agencies when seeking employment opportunities abroad.

title: Passenger arrested over attempt to sexually abuse two flight attendants
byline: A passenger who attempted to sexually abuse two female flight attendants on a flight from Singapore to Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake has been arrested by the Airport Police.

title: Oscar-winning Indian composer AR Rahman hospitalized
byline: Oscar-winning music composer AR Rahman has been admitted to a Chennai hospital after he complained about chest pain. The music maestro is at Apollo hospital on Greams Road, as per an India Today report.

title: NPP MP reveals govt’s foreign employment plans for South Korea, Japan, and Israel
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) MP Ajith Gihan has explained how the government intends to provide foreign employment opportunities in countries including South Korea, Japan, and Israel.

title: Former President Ranil’s special statement on ‘Batalanda’ Commission report
byline: Issuing a special statement today (16), former President Ranil Wickremesinghe categorically rejected the ‘Batalanda’ Commission report.

title: O/L Exam: Over 474,000 candidates registered, key instructions issued
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, Amith Jayasundara, stated that 474,147 candidates have applied for the 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) examination.

title: EC issues criteria for rejecting nomination papers in LG Elections
byline: The Election Commission has issued a special announcement regarding the possible reasons for rejecting nomination papers submitted for the Local Government Elections.

title: CID directed not to arrest OIC of CCD and 5 others over 2023 Weligama shooting
byline: An agreement has been reached between the Attorney General (AG) and the petitioners’ lawyers regarding the 2023 shooting incident near a hotel in Weligama.

title: Six arrested over violence at musical show in Medirigiriya
byline: Six persons have been arrested in connection with the violent incidents that occurred during a recent musical show at Divulankadawala in Medirigiriya, the police said.

title: Train services delayed due to signal system failure
byline: Train services on all lines have been delayed due to a signal system failure between Colombo Fort and Maradana railway stations, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Weather advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for severe lightning for several provinces and districts.

title: Death toll from North Macedonia nightclub fire rises to 59
byline: At least 59 people have been killed and more than 155 injured in a nightclub fire in North Macedonia, officials say.

title: Emergency hotlines for O/L candidates to seek assistance during disaster situations
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) and the Department of Examinations have planned to initiate a special joint program to conduct the examination while avoiding possible disruptions due to unexpected weather conditions that may occur during the period when the 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) examination is being held.

title: Sri Lanka seeks joint venture investments in Bangladesh
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed its willingness to invest in joint ventures in Bangladesh, particularly in synthetic fabric manufacturing, which holds significant potential for investors from both nations, Sri Lankan High Commissioner to Bangladesh Dharmapala Weerakkody said today.

title: Uncertainty still prevails on Adani’s exit from Sri Lanka RE project
byline: The Sri Lankan Energy Ministry had reached out to the local arm of Adani Green Energy Ltd to find out the reason behind their proposed exit.
